question: 0.48 g of an organic compound on complete combustion produced 0.22 g of <katex>$CO_{2}$</katex>. The percentage of C in the given organic compound is : [cite: 261-263]
explanation: Percentage of C = <katex>$\frac{12}{44} \times \frac{\text{mass of } CO_2}{\text{mass of compound}} \times 100$</katex>. Calculation: <katex>$\frac{12}{44} \times \frac{0.22}{0.48} \times 100 = 12.5\%$</katex>. [cite: 265, 267]
